column2: Imara, Inc. is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company. The Company is developing and commercializing therapeutics to treat patients suffering from rare inherited genetic disorders of hemoglobin. The Companyâ€™s product pipeline include IMR-687, which is an oral, once-a-day, potentially disease-modifying treatment for sickle cell disease (SCD), and beta-thalassemia. Its IMR-687 is a selective, small molecule inhibitor of phosphodiesterase-9 (PDE9). The Company is conducting a Phase 2a clinical trial of IMR-687 in adult patients with SCD and a Phase 2b clinical trial for the treatment of patients with beta-thalassemia.
